Sofitel Singapore City Centre
8.5 Excellent
Based on 9 reviews

Marina Bay Sands
8.5 Excellent
Based on 20539 reviews

Singapore, what a fantastic city, economic example to the rest of the world, and where I was to spend the last 2 days of my travelling south east asia for 3 weeks.

All completely overshadowed and ruined by staying at the MBS hotel. I'll cut to the chase, SGD$1600 for a moderate amount of non-special item laundry, not even half a suitcase. A completely obscene amount (£1000 / US$1200 in case you thought you had mis-read) which I felt duped into signing for as a weary traveller who at no point was told by a member of staff what the total would be. After having spoken to my local Singaporean friend, who herself was astonished and embarrassed on behalf of the hotel, proceeded to put the figure into perspective; SGD$1600 --> equal to three quarters an average monthly salary of a hotel worker, SGD$1600 -->equal to half the minimum monthly salary of a foreign employee on an E-Pass, and, as it seems... SGD$1600 --> equal to getting some pants shirts and socks dry-cleaned at MBS hotel!!! Note that our 2 night stay cost around the same in total otherwise. Totally stonewalled by the front desk team who were totally ignorant of the obscene charge for laundry. At least, if they were not ignorant, the alternative is they are all in cahoots with senior management to effectively trick paying guests into an absolutely abhorrantly big bill for washing some pants!!!

Show more
Jonathan , United Kingdom
Mandarin Orchard Singapore
8.3 Excellent
Based on 16961 reviews

I am so disappointed with their housekeeping. I stayed on the 25th floor in Orchard Tower. On the second night, we returned late.

While the sink area looks like it had been cleaned, I noticed that the kimono had not been tidied and the toiletries in the shower were not straightened out. I thought I was being nitpicky and waived it off. The next day, we came back around 8PM and found out that surely the shower had not been cleaned because there was still hair from the day before. Cookie crumbs from the side table had not been cleaned either. I called to complain, but it was too late for me to accept any cleaning crew as my kids were already going to bed. The day after, as we were walking to the elevator to check out, we saw the cleaning lady sitting down on the office chair, using her phone on the desk. I expected more from Meritus Mandarin. While the room was comfortable, I was made wondered of how well the room had been cleaned.

Show more
Vania , Indonesia
Carlton Hotel Singapore
8.2 Excellent
Based on 16210 reviews

We had our wedding in Chijmes and booked our wedding suite and entourage room in Carlton in late Sep 2016 due to proximity of the hotel to our wedding venue.

The hotel was recommended to our overseas guests and a few of them booked Carlton as well. My review is going to focus on the two bookings that were made by us (the wedding couple) and our experience dealing with the hotel. We booked our bridal suite via their hotel website and a room from Agoda for our entourage to freshen themselves before the dinner. We have initially requested for early check in but did not receive any reply from the hotel representatives nor the agent. Thinking that our early check in was not entertained, we arranged our program to have a photoshoot at Chijmes first before arriving at the hotel at to check in. We arrived at the hotel at 3:35pm as confirmed by the hotel. Although the stated check in time for the hotel was 3:00pm, both the suite and the entourage rooms were not ready when we arrived at that time. What happened next was the start of the absolute nightmare. The whole group of us were in our bridal attire (right after the photoshoot) as we waited to check in like any ordinary guest the lobby. We booked the deluxe room for our bridal party under our groomsman's name. When it came to our turn, the receptionist insisted that he show his i/c and documents. I tried to save us time by explaining to her that both bookings were made on my Amex credit card (which the same credit card I used for the suite as well) which I tried to show her. In my bridal gown (of 2 metres train) trying to explain to the receptionist to get the room key, she sternly insisted that she will need to physically see his I/C as that was just hotel policy… so okay, my groomsman ran back to Chijmes and showed her the documents as we stood at the lobby waiting. We waited for a good 25 mins before they came back to us. Most of us had to be at the rehearsal and make up in Chijmes by 4:30pm so we hurried them. B

Show more
Shi , Malaysia
Hotel Boss
7.8 Very good
Based on 4658 reviews

First of all, the location of the hotel is excellent, just 300m from the Lavender MRT station. There are also a decent food court, as well as various other restaurants just downstairs.

I booked a "city view" room, but they gave me a wrong room initially. Luckily they corrected that mistake, and gave me a much better room. Unfortunately, I think the staffs were mostly inexperienced, as if they just started out working at the hotel. Overall, the rate and location are both excellent. For that I can overlook the staff and a few of the other minor things not mentioned here.

Show more
Wai , Hong Kong
V Hotel Lavender
7.4 Very good
Based on 29323 reviews

Room small, bed a bit hard and not comfortable. The hotel provide handy phone to explore singapore without buy sim card, we can request mineral water, tea , coffee, creamer and suger at any time without limit.

This is the good point considering the expensive mineral water and other bottle drinks. When we check in they gave us room with broken air conditioner, we need to wait a while for technician without solution, then they asked us to come to receptionist again to change the card for other room. The room 767 with good air conditioner but the handy charger is broken but this is not a big problems.The suggestion for the hotel is to check the room condition before let your guest check in and offer excellent service to your guest by deliver the new access card to your guest room. your guest may travel for several hours and need to take a quick rest before going out to explore your city. Thank You.

Show more
Jenita , Indonesia
Hotel G Singapore
8.3 Excellent
Based on 2017 reviews

For all young/ bussines traveler who are looking for good deal price, this hotel is very reccomended.

But not suitable for families with children or elderly . I love this hotel for its Reasonable price for all facilities they have , Good location + edgy artsy ambiance + efficient furniture+ small but comfort room spaces+ good variety and quality breakfast ( compare to other hotel with same price) + very fast wifi !! + they even provide ice and water in the hallway for you can refill your bottle. They staff was quite helpful and very effective but lack of smile Maybe because they seem always busy with all the check in and check out process. Definetely will come back to here for my bussiness trip. just information, -since the hotel quite new not many taxi driver know how to go to the lobby which is locate in 2nd floor and for traveler using taxi/ car has to reach it through the parking lot which entrance is on the back of the building .

Show more
novita , Indonesia
Grand Park Orchard
8.2 Excellent
Based on 8114 reviews

This hotel is always my first option when I go to SG because of its proximity to Orchard and because they still have smoking room.

My last trip in Feb turned out to be a big disappointment cause first they cannot locate my cardigan which I acciddently left in my room during my previous stay in January. Not only because it is a new and very nice cardigan which I used only once (before I lost it) - but also because the front office managed to blame me since I did not write to them about the cardigan when I left it in the first place. I called about 5 minutes after I left the hotel in January and the FO asked me to call later to check my room first, and when I called the second time they managed to secure my cardigan from my room. They promised to keep it until someone get it. I did not write since I thought I am coming in February after all - Well, surprise, surprise, when I came in Feb, no one can tell where my cardigan has gone - what a mystery - Anyways, it is still the same nice hotel, with nice wifi, nice location -- however, if they want to keep the smoking room, they need to invest more on cleaning the hallway and the rooms. I just came back from SG last week, guess what? I did not stay in Grand Park Orchard this time.

Show more
Christina , Indonesia
York Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 12488 reviews

A few problems with my room this time that greatly affected my experience. Firstly, I had booked a queen bed.

When I was checking in, they tried to give me 2 sgl beds. Minor irritation, but not a good way to start my stay. AC temperature dial in my room kept clicking, oddly in the wee hours. I was woken up every morning, early, by this. Whenever water was used in the bathroom - sink, toilet or bathtub, the air would reek of sewage. Seems like they have an issue with the pipes. There would also be a weird loud noise in the drainage area. Walls are v thin. I could hear my neighbor, not just talking, but their every word, every shout & every slam of the door. They were v noisy in the mornings. Housekeeping called me in my room, even though I had a Do Not Disturb sign on my door, wanting to clean it. I was trying to rest that afternoon as I was exhausted from a hectic schedule & interrupted sleep.

Show more
Anita , United States
PARKROYAL on Kitchener Road Singapore
7.7 Very good
Based on 3504 reviews

I travelled with my 64 y/o Mom and it was our first time stayed at Park Royal Hotel on Kitchener Rd. Only 1 minute to Mustafa Center, 1 minute to Farrer Park MRT station, 1 minute to City Square Mall.

Cant you tell how happy my Mom was LOL. The Hotel surrounded by lots of halaal food/resto so no need to pay for Hotel breakfast LOL kidding. Most of the staffs are cool and welcome. We arrived at the Hotel quite early and we were able to get an early check in (so lucky!) only once I noticed that on Mar 23-24, the Hotel was so busy so we got our room cleaned quite late and no luggage service came to our door after 15 minutes of waiting (therefore I had to cancel the luggage service request). But in overall we were very satisfied with the service (despite those super busy days) and surely will come back again.

Show more
Putri , Indonesia
Marina Mandarin Singapore Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 7090 reviews

I stayed for 3 nights from 25 to 28 June 2017. Because of my need to rush for another appointment, I went to the hotel to "register" at about 8am.

During the registration, I informed the reception that my wife will be coming in late at about 11pm. To ensure easy access for my wife, I gave the reception the full details. I was also told to get the access card for my room from the concierge when I check in later. After the registration, instead of getting someone to handle by luggage, the reception asked me to go down to level 1 and passed it to the concierge myself. Is this 5-star hotel standard?? When I return to the hotel at about 6.30pm, I approached the concierge to get my access card. It was not ready. I had to wait for the staff to start programming and to make matter worse, I had to inform the staff again about the arrangement for my wife. Yes, the staff had to ask for my wife's details again even though it was given in the morning. Is this a 5-star standard? After the ordeal, I was looking forward to have my red wine in my room. To my horror, this 5-star hotel does not provide wine glass in the room. I had to call the housekeeping to request for it, which took them about 15 minutes to deliver. When they did deliver the wine glasses, I had a rule shock to see how minuscule the wine glasses were. After a drink in that tiny wine glass, I proceeded to take a shower. I wanted to find a shaver in the bathroom to shave, but could not find one. I later learnt from the duty manager, this 5-star does not provide shaver unless you call the housekeeping to arrange for one. My worst experience was when I had to get another access key for my room. I went to level 4 which is the reception level. There was a queue with about 5 guests. While waiting in the queue, I noticed a staff in uniform was talking to one of the 3 receptionists. Even though she did notice that there was a queue, she continued to engage in a discussion with the receptionist. I believe for a fiv

Show more
choo , Singapore
Peninsula Excelsior Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 10512 reviews

Awful experience from check-in to check-out. Card reading sensor at room was dead on battery, waited for half an hour before duty manager came up to re-assign a different room.

That night itself, my room card couldn't access the room, apparently the sensor's battery was going to die off soon too. The same thing happened on the third and last night again, and that lady duty manager had the guts to ask if she could send an engineer to check the sensor. It was late and I was tired, all I want to do is retire and rest. I told her to to do the checking after I check-out the next day. Prior to checking out, I had to leave the hotel for some last minute shopping. Couldn't access the room when I got back. Complained again to the duty manager Henry, to be fair, was very apologetic and helpful. He let me in into my room and I thought to myself, everything will be okay since I will be checking out in two more hours. Henry offered me a complimentary lunch which I declined as I wasn't hungry. Already requested for late check-out at 1:00pm, but housekeeping just walked my room at 12:25pm when I was half-naked! No prior doorbell ringing at all! I was out of words, they just never failed to disappoint me at all costs from Day1 to Day5. The hotel is quite worn out as it is an old hotel, thus the room is quite spacious compared to some other newer hotels in Singapore. My advice to the hotel is to check all the batteries of their room sensors to ensure none other patrons will experience what I did. Henry was very helpful but that wasn't sufficient to compensate for the frustration that I felt in that 5 days. I will never return for a second stay, as there are still so many hotels to choose from.

Show more
Junie , Malaysia
Hotel Jen Tanglin Singapore by Shangri-la
7.8 Very good
Based on 2787 reviews

I was disappointed that I wasn't informed of the fire drill upon checking in. My baby was taking his nap when the fire alarm went off and repeated many times, until I thought it was a real fire alarm.

I had to call the front desk to find out if I should leave the room. Only then I was told that it was just a fire drill. If only i was informed about the fire drill upon checking in, I could have plan something for baby in the afternoon so that his nap time wouldn't be affected. Our night events was also ruined because of the disrupted nap.

Show more
jasmine , Singapore
Royal Plaza on Scotts Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 8709 reviews

I took a chance on this hotel as all the other chain hotels like the Marriott or Hyatt on Orchard Road were either full or very expensive.

I'm very glad I did and I would definitely stay here again. The hotel is perfectly located on Orchard Road along side all the malls and there's easy access to the Orchard MRT. There's even a Starbucks right up front. The hotel room was very spacious and clean. The staff friendly. The only thing l missed vs the other hotels is a lobby area that is conducive to meeting or gathering. I needed to meet with someone for about an hour and had to meet at Starbucks. Other than that, this is quite on par with other 4+star hotels at better value.

Show more
Elisa , United States
YOTEL Singapore Orchard Road
8.8 Excellent
Based on 197 reviews

Great location but needs more visible signages for taxis to easily locate...bathroom tho gets clogged during shower in Rm.

2027..very friendly and attentive housekeeping services on the 20th floor..front desk easily accedes to request for taxi...very fragrant and clean smell from elevator to lobby...there is a need to coordinate and monitor bookings thru Agoda so as not to cause delay in accommodating and assigning rooms to Agoda clients.( I booked thru Agoda but I had to wait for an available room for more than 30 minutes) They should provide simple greetings/token/flowers to their clients who celebrate their birthdays (it was my birthday as I stayed there ) anniversary, etc....Still I'd say, I love Yotel!

Show more
Dulce , Philippines
Concorde Hotel Singapore
7.9 Very good
Based on 4569 reviews

I stayed during Hari Raya Holiday, I choose Deluxe Triple Room, for three person. I should have 1 king bed and 1 single bed.

. first time I came in my room there are only one King Bed, so I have to complained about the 1 single bed.. after 30 minutes the single bed coming... the room is old and ugly, bed smell, the carpet look old and dirty, there are many dirty spot on the carpet.. I stay for 4 nights.. at the First night my Air Conditioning control is broken, so the room felt so cold and we're freezing all night, we can't sleep.. at the second day the housekeeping didn't clean my room at all.. I did complained.. and I ask to move to another room, they gave me a new renovation room, but still I have to ask about the single bed again.. and they are bad of facilities, I should have 3 water mineral for 3 person in room, but they are only gave me 2.. everyday I had to complained to housekeeping about the room condition.. this is the worse hotel I'have ever stay in Singapore.

Show more
galuh , Indonesia
V Hotel Bencoolen
7.1 Very good
Based on 5818 reviews

The hotel is very close to the MRT station which made it easy to get around. There's also a food court 5 minutes walk away which is where we spent most of our mealtimes.

Bugis Junction is only 20 minutes walk away. The hotel staff is friendly and approachable. The only negative that we have would be that the walls in the rooms were really thin so it does get a bit noisy in the morning. The room is a bit cramped especially if you have a lot of luggages, however, that's expected for a budget hotel in Singapore. As we were out most of the day, this was not a big issue for us and the bed was quite comfortable. The hotel also provides a coin laundry near the pool on Level 3, which is a great service if you needed some fresh clothes after being out in the heat. Overall, we have had a pretty decent stay at V hotel and would definitely come back again!

Show more
xindi , Australia
One Farrer Hotel and Spa
8.9 Excellent
Based on 2168 reviews

First time to One Farrer (Skyline Room) - Aug 2015 - the first ever staycation I did with my girlfriend, and then second staycation in the (Skyline Suite) - Nov 2015 were amazing.

Rooms were very clean, and service was amazing. Staff would carry your bag from check in to your room. I also received access to the Skyline Lounge where Fadhi and Malek provided top notch hospitality. On my 2nd visit, I was even left a note to welcome me back to the One Farrer. The hotel was also always in constant communication with me in relation to any requests or things I wanted to arrange. Following these experiences we had referred many of our friends from overseas to come stay at One Farrer when they visited us in Singapore. Fast forward to my recent 3rd visit (Skyline Room) - I'm very disappointed especially given I planned this as a 2 year anniversary staycation with my girlfriend to relive that awesome 'first staycation' experience. Some pros - still good variety at breakfast, rooms / facilities are modern and generally clean, gym has most equipment you need, hotel did get a small cake for 2nd anniversary to celebrate Now for the troubling issues.... Issue 1. Lack of communication up front from hotel; and find out I have no lounge access despite it not saying lounge is excluded. I booked a Skyline Room on Agoda about 1.5 months before the stay and had written a special request and message in the booking notes of my enjoyable stays previously. However following that, no email or communication was ever sent back to me, nor was it ever suggested to me that lounge access was not included (despite my special request message including my previous experiences) or about my occasion. When I got to checkin, they explained they had changed their T&Cs recently so that any Skyline Room booking does not include any lounge access, as compared to previously when all Skyline Room bookings did include lounge access. On Agoda, the rooms just say ''Skyline Room with Breakfast' so I assumed t

Show more
Kingsley , Australia
Hotel Mi
8.1 Excellent
Based on 130 reviews

Booked the biggest room in MI hotel (family room) via Agoda. Ringed up the hotel to check info & informed that it was my wedding anniversary and asked if the hotel could do something special for us - the answer was “we could have given you an upgrade to a bigger room but you have already booked the biggest room, so there is nothing we can do for you.

” What a disappointing answer. During checked in, instead of being greeted with a “Happy Wedding Anniversary!”, the counter staff looked at me worrying and said, “You bringing in the balloons? Instead of a private pool, you had to share a common free-form swimming lagoon with the other villas. Each villa had its own outdoor jacuzzi although it is NOT private as the patio and jacuzzi are open to view from your neighbours. Moreover, the beach villa is a misnomer as there is no beach. We are with our elderly mom (barely speaks english) and baby girl (1yr old) so the situation is a little tricky. They can't come with the ambulance but I cant leave them alone as well. I didnt have to ask, but the manager assured me and ask me to have my focus on my husband and they will take care of our mum and baby. They let them back in to our hotel room without extra charge. This one gesture truly made the situation more bearable to me. THANK YOU AGAIN! About location, services and cleanliness overall I am satisfied. There is more to explore to the place as its spacious. Wild wild wet is just walking distance and you have free pass to the park when you check in (at least that time). Truly will come back again.

Show more
Lou , Singapore
DKranji Farm Resort
6.4 Good
Based on 681 reviews

Have a short stay in this hotel and must recommend this resort as it was clean and comfortable. I booked a superior villa as the price is very reasonable in weekend(about $190).

The room is small but fit well for 2 persons. The bathroom is open concept style so it is quite unique experience to shower outdoor. All shampoo, body washer and towels are prepared in the resort. I saw few photos from the reviews that there is bug in the bathroom but I didn't see any bugs so far. The bathroom is comfortable and we enjoy the shower without any concern.The room also has a fridge so it let us to store the cake for my girlfriend. There is a Chinese restaurant near to the resort (5 to 6 minutes walking). The Chinese restaurant provides quite a wide choices of food. We only orders a tofu, pork and fried rice. Surprisingly the food was nice and we love it. There is also a bar nearby the Chinese restaurant. There is karaoke session during weekend at night and we chilled in the bar and order some beer. It was fun and relax. Besides this, there is also a prawning place nearby to the resort. However my girlfriend doesn't like prawning so I didn't give it a try. The price is $18 per hour, kinda expensive but you can get cheaper rate if you prawn for longer hours. Overall the resort provides me a great short getaway experience. You wont feel that you are staying in Singapore over there. There is also a lot of star we could see at night. Definitely will come back to this resort next time!

Show more
Ong , Malaysia
Arena Suites
7.2 Very good
Based on 153 reviews

Located at a no man's land this inhabitated resort neighbored by an army camp is definitely one to be overlooked upon.

This resort is capped with mediocre facilities like the swimming pool , gym and sauna and one would have expected the rooms to be much as the same. Well do not be deceived by the outlook of this facilities as the rooms provided serves us with an ambience of at least a 4 star suite and it is as comfortable as being in our very own apartment. Complete with a kitchen (washing machine provided) one would know where to spent a short getaway and get the laundry done at the same time. And what is more interesting is that the drinks and snacks are complimentary!! The resort which feels like it would gather expatriates rather then tourist is amazingly comfortable. However if you think that this resort will get you serenity away from the city then you will be dissapointed by the alarming go cart racers and morning swimming classes.(i suggest stay in your room).And well breakfast is provided with a claim voucher of probably a worth 3 dollars or less meal over at the "kopitiam" equivalent to a hawker. Apart from the room, the patient and understanding ununiformed counter staff completes the pleasing stay. All in all this resort or rather suite just needs to get an identity and being a 3 months old resort, it commands another trip.

mohamed , Singapore
Punggol Ranch Resort
6.7 Good
Based on 126 reviews

Punggol Ranch is a unique hotel in Singapore which offers a farmstay like atmosphere. You can ride horses or having a BBQ with your friends/family.

The rooms (which resemble wagons) are spacious and each has fireplace. It is a perfect place to relax for one or 2 days and having a good time, experience nature and seeing animals (horses and ponies). Nevertheless: the hotel staff does not clean the room everyday - it's upon the guest to let the staff know to clean the room - we did not get informed about this in advance so our room got a bit sandy after 2 days. Also there are no fridges in the room, they must be rented. Very special since it is a BBQ place also. The hotel desk operates at regular working hours. It closes after 7pm. Thus if you have any issues you will have to wait until the next day.

Samuel , Switzerland
Celestial Ubin Beach Resort
5.6 Review score
Based on 24 reviews

I believe this is the only resort in Pulau Ubin. The hotel was about 5mins walking distance away from the jetty, tucked in a corner near the Coast Guards headquarter.

They have a private beach where you can kayak..you can rent bicycles from the reception and there is fish spa available too :) The standard room we got was a bedroom within a 2-bedroom chalet unit. There was a communal kitchen but do not think people used it because it appeared unkept. Room was clean, comfortable but please do not expect a room like chalets on Singapore mainland, i.e.Downtown East. There were cobwebs around wall corners and bed was creaky. TV received Indonesian channels better, air con and water heater worked fine :) Do bring along mosquito repellent, be it spray or electric, a must-have in Ubin. If you are thinking of exploring the Java wetlands, do consider renting a bike nearer to jetty because the bikes available at resort reception are non-geared, i.e. very challenging to overcome up-slopes for the wetlands route. Overall, price steep for the room you get but you will have a pleasant time if you are moderate your expectations :)

I've been to Singapore for vacation about 5 times and the reason why I go back here is because I feel safe, and I love to shop.

Whether it be a designer item, or some random art shop along orchard road... you'll find it here. Also, for a small country there are a lot of other sights you can visit. Everything is so convenient here, it's actually hard to get lost! I love how everything is organized and so interconnected, from bus stops, to train stations- you're never too far away from great sights! I would recommend for some romance, the gardens by the bay at night, the top of marina bay sands (don't forget to try ku de ta and the chocolate buffet!)... siloso is normally where they have their beach parties, orchard road for shopping, my personal faves are takashimaya and ion orchard. I also frequent ikea during my visits because in my country, we have no ikea. The singapore flyer is a nice way to see the city. I also would recommend maybe for first timers the Hippo tours which really helped me get an orientation of the city. If you're lucky, you might chance upon nice exhibits in the Singapore National Museum- I actually saw Van Gogh's starry starry night here! Food is excellent here too! Make sure to do your research and don't forget to try the laksa, chicken rice, bak ku teh and other singaporean fare.

More about Singapore

Singapore is one of Southeast Asia's most glamorous capitals, being a major travel hub and a shopper's paradise. This famously clean and orderly city state is served by Changi Airportwhich is easily reached from hotels in Singapore city center by rail or car.

Orchard Roadis Singapore's most renowned area where mall after mega-mall form one of the world's most comprehensive shopping districts all within a beautiful atmosphere.

Singapore's marina front is home to the city's arts scene as well as the iconic architecture which stands dazzling against sparkling waters.

Visitors to Singapore are spoiled for choice in terms of dining and entertainment. Clarke Quayis one of the most recently renovated entertainment areas and is just as popular with tourists as it is with locals. Little India offers a more bohemian atmosphere, with cafes interspersed amongst budget eateries, English-style pubs, and affordable guesthouse accommodations nestled in rustic pre-war townhouses. Bugis Junction is also a noteworthy area with freshly renovated cobblestone streets, markets, and brightly painted buildings which attract hip young locals. Singapore is a city full of diversity with a careful design that emphasizes beauty and functionality.

This famously clean and orderly city state is served by Changi Airport which is easily reached from hotels in Singapore city center by rail or car. Orchard Road is Singapore's most renowned area where mall after mega-mall form one of the world's most comprehensive shopping districts all within a beautiful atmosphere. Singapore's marina front is home to the city's arts scene as well as the iconic architecture which stands dazzling against sparkling waters. Visitors to Singapore are spoiled for choice in terms of dining and entertainment. Clarke Quay is one of the most recently renovated entertainment areas and is just as popular with tourists as it is with locals. Little India offers a more bohemian atmosphere, with cafes interspersed amongst budget eateries, English-style pubs, and affordable guesthouse accommodations nestled in rustic pre-war townhouses. Bugis Junction is also a noteworthy area with freshly renovated cobblestone streets, markets, and brightly painted buildings which attract hip young locals. Singapore is a city full of diversity with a careful design that emphasizes beauty and functionality.
